Removing the Desktop App
Table of Contents
Introduction
Removing the Binary
Removing the Configuration File
Windows Navigation Sidebar
Introduction
This page describes the necessary steps to remove the Desktop App. Windows Navigation Sidebar
If you have removed the Desktop App but still have the ownCloud shortcut or symbol in the Windows Navigation Side Bar, here is how you to remove it:
Open
regedit
. (press the Windows Key and type regedit)
Search (CTL+F) for the name of the Desktop App, in this case
owncloud
. Automatic Updating

Removing the Binary
Follow the procedures of your operating system about how to remove the Desktop App binary. When using an AppImage, just delete the AppImage file. Removing the Configuration File
When you remove the Desktop App — the configuration file remains on your system. In case you want a clean removal of the Desktop App, you manually have to delete the configuration file. Once this is done, you don’t need a reboot, just open and close your explorer — the sidebar is clean.

If you then decide to install the client again, you won’t need to re-enter the connection information. The location of the configuration file is operating system dependent and can be found in the
Configuration File
description. Once for the
x64
and
x32
system settings.

Press
F3
for next search result. Look for the key
System.IsPinnedToNameSpaceTree
. Right-click on the key name, change, set to
0
instead of
1
.
You have to do this twice.
